column5: Great if it works.  I have never seen someone use that many crank baits for ice fishing though.  http://www.scout.com/outdoors/wired2fish/story/1618325-how-to-store-crankbaits-snag-free
Genius! Simple, cheap(free) and effective. Now why didn't I think of that?  Thanks!  muddler
That's a neat idea! I think I'll wait for the Rapala Jar and elastic combo to hit my local CTC! LOL HH
They are all lipless baits for more vertical fishing, wonder if it works with lipped baits as well ?
cool idea for a fly in
Yea it does  Been doing it for years but i still store in plano boxes
And if you want one in the bottom you get to dump the entire container out to get it...
Thats why I still use plano boxes lol
But the idea of using elastic bands still will work on plano boxes.
Great idea!  Now what am I going to do with all those trays I purchased?  Garage sale?
Guess that dude likes ice fishing with rattle baits!  Holy cow.
Just remember to replace those rubber bands periodically.Once they get dried out and hard its a pain on lures that don't rarely get used or only get used seasonally. Kerry
